laboratory_examinations.findings: Nonvariola orthopoxvirus was detected in vesicular scrapings and viral culture supernatant.
Staphylococcus aureus was isolated from initial blood and skin cultures.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent cultures showed no bacterial growth.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Vaccinia virus DNA load showed a decreasing trend from day 7 onward and was undetectable at day 18.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The load decreased daily until it became undetectable by day 18.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete blood cell count with differential
laboratory_examinations.findings: Hematologic complications included neutropenia, anemia, and thrombocytopenia; all complications resolved.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: All hematologic complications resolved while the child continued treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No detectable orthopoxvirus-specific IgG response but high IgM antibody level and elevated serum vaccinia virus-neutralization titer.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Maximum IgG levels were achieved between hospital days 12 and 18.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma levels were adjusted based on pharmacokinetic data.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Doses were adjusted daily based on monitored plasma levels until treatment was discontinued.
